info.title: SecurityCenter

nextLink.description: The URI to fetch the next page.

resourceStatus.description: The status of the resource regarding a single assessment

values.description: This assessment on the resource is healthy
This assessment is not applicable to this resource
This assessment is turned off by policy on this subscription
This assessment on the resource is not healthy

AscLocation.description: The ASC location of the subscription is in the "name" field

Location.description: Describes an Azure resource with location

location.description: Location where the resource is stored

Kind.description: Describes an Azure resource with kind

ETag.description: Entity tag is used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource.

etag.description: Entity tag is used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource.

Tags.description: A list of key value pairs that describe the resource.

tags.description: A list of key value pairs that describe the resource.

code.description: An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.description: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

Pricing.description: Azure Security Center is provided in two pricing tiers: free and standard, with the standard tier available with a trial period. The standard tier offers advanced security capabilities, while the free tier offers basic security features.

PricingProperties.description: Pricing properties for the relevant scope

pricingTier.description: The pricing tier value. Azure Security Center is provided in two pricing tiers: free and standard, with the standard tier available with a trial period. The standard tier offers advanced security capabilities, while the free tier offers basic security features.

values.description: Get free Azure security center experience with basic security features
Get the standard Azure security center experience with advanced security features

freeTrialRemainingTime.description: The duration left for the subscriptions free trial period - in ISO 8601 format (e.g. P3Y6M4DT12H30M5S).

nextLink.description: The URI to fetch the next page.

state.description: State of the alert (Active, Dismissed etc.)

reportedTimeUtc.description: The time the incident was reported to Microsoft.Security in UTC

vendorName.description: Name of the vendor that discovered the incident

alertDisplayName.description: Display name of the alert type

detectedTimeUtc.description: The time the incident was detected by the vendor

description.description: Description of the incident and what it means

remediationSteps.description: Recommended steps to reradiate the incident

actionTaken.description: The action that was taken as a response to the alert (Active, Blocked etc.)

compromisedEntity.description: The entity that the incident happened on

associatedResource.description: Azure resource ID of the associated resource

systemSource.description: The type of the alerted resource (Azure, Non-Azure)

canBeInvestigated.description: Whether this alert can be investigated with Azure Security Center

isIncident.description: Whether this alert is for incident type or not (otherwise - single alert)

entities.description: objects that are related to this alerts

confidenceScore.description: level of confidence we have on the alert

confidenceReasons.description: reasons the alert got the confidenceScore value

subscriptionId.description: Azure subscription ID of the resource that had the security alert or the subscription ID of the workspace that this resource reports to

workspaceArmId.description: Azure resource ID of the workspace that the alert was reported to.

correlationKey.description: Alerts with the same CorrelationKey will be grouped together in Ibiza.

AlertConfidenceReason.description: Factors that increase our confidence that the alert is a true positive

AlertEntity.description: Changing set of properties depending on the entity type.

AlertExtendedProperties.description: Changing set of properties depending on the alert type.

nextLink.description: The URI to fetch the next page.

Setting.description: Represents a security setting in Azure Security Center.

SettingResource.description: The kind of the security setting

kind.description: the kind of the settings string (DataExportSettings)

enabled.description: Is the data export setting is enabled

isEnabled.description: Indicates whether Advanced Threat Protection is enabled.

value.description: List of device security group objects

nextLink.description: The URI to fetch the next page.

DeviceSecurityGroupProperties.description: describes properties of a security group.

thresholdRules.description: The list of custom alert threshold rules.

timeWindowRules.description: The list of custom alert time-window rules.

displayName.description: The display name of the custom alert.

description.description: The description of the custom alert.

ruleType.description: The type of the custom alert rule.

valueType.description: The value type of the items in the list.

values.description: An IP range in CIDR format (e.g. '192.168.0.1/8').
Any string value.

AllowlistCustomAlertRule.description: A custom alert rule that checks if a value (depends on the custom alert type) is allowed.

allowlistValues.description: The values to allow. The format of the values depends on the rule type.

ConnectionToIpNotAllowed.description: Outbound connection to an ip that isn't allowed. Allow list consists of ipv4 or ipv6 range in CIDR notation.

LocalUserNotAllowed.description: Login by a local user that isn't allowed. Allow list consists of login names to allow.

ProcessNotAllowed.description: Execution of a process that isn't allowed. Allow list consists of process names to allow.

DenylistCustomAlertRule.description: A custom alert rule that checks if a value (depends on the custom alert type) is denied.

denylistValues.description: The values to deny. The format of the values depends on the rule type.

ThresholdCustomAlertRule.description: A custom alert rule that checks if a value (depends on the custom alert type) is within the given range.

TimeWindowCustomAlertRule.description: A custom alert rule that checks if the number of activities (depends on the custom alert type) in a time window is within the given range.

timeWindowSize.description: The time window size in iso8601 format.

ActiveConnectionsNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of active connections is not in allowed range.

AmqpC2DMessagesNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of cloud to device messages (AMQP protocol) is not in allowed range.

MqttC2DMessagesNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of cloud to device messages (MQTT protocol) is not in allowed range.

HttpC2DMessagesNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of cloud to device messages (HTTP protocol) is not in allowed range.

AmqpC2DRejectedMessagesNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of rejected cloud to device messages (AMQP protocol) is not in allowed range.

MqttC2DRejectedMessagesNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of rejected cloud to device messages (MQTT protocol) is not in allowed range.

HttpC2DRejectedMessagesNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of rejected cloud to device messages (HTTP protocol) is not in allowed range.

AmqpD2CMessagesNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of device to cloud messages (AMQP protocol) is not in allowed range.

MqttD2CMessagesNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of device to cloud messages (MQTT protocol) is not in allowed range.

HttpD2CMessagesNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of device to cloud messages (HTTP protocol) is not in allowed range.

DirectMethodInvokesNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of direct method invokes is not in allowed range.

FailedLocalLoginsNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of failed local logins is not in allowed range.

FileUploadsNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of file uploads is not in allowed range.

QueuePurgesNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of device queue purges is not in allowed range.

TwinUpdatesNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of twin updates is not in allowed range.

UnauthorizedOperationsNotInAllowedRange.description: Number of unauthorized operations is not in allowed range.

TagsResource.description: A container holding only the Tags for a resource, allowing the user to update the tags.

nextLink.description: The URI to fetch the next page.

IoTSecuritySolutionModel.description: IoT Security solution configuration and resource information.

status.description: Status of the IoT Security solution.

values.description: Agent raw events

export.description: List of additional options for exporting to workspace data.

values.description: Devices twin data

disabledDataSources.description: Disabled data sources. Disabling these data sources compromises the system.

autoDiscoveredResources.description: List of resources that were automatically discovered as relevant to the security solution.

values.description: Unmasked IP logging is disabled
Unmasked IP logging is enabled

UserDefinedResourcesProperties.description: Properties of the IoT Security solution's user defined resources.

query.description: Azure Resource inventory query which represents the security solution's user defined resources. Required to start with "where type != "Microsoft.Devices/IotHubs""

querySubscriptions.description: List of Azure subscription ids on which the user defined resources query should be executed.

RecommendationConfigurationProperties.description: The type of IoT Security recommendation.

recommendationType.description: The type of IoT Security recommendation.

values.description: Authentication schema used for pull an edge module from an ACR repository does not use Service Principal Authentication.
IoT agent message size capacity is currently underutilized, causing an increase in the number of sent messages. Adjust message intervals for better utilization.
Identified security related system configuration issues.
You can optimize Edge Hub memory usage by turning off protocol heads for any protocols not used by Edge modules in your solution.
Logging is disabled for this edge module.
A minority within a device security group has inconsistent Edge Module settings with the rest of their group.
Install the Azure Security of Things Agent.
IP Filter Configuration should have rules defined for allowed traffic and should deny all other traffic by default.
An Allow IP Filter rules source IP range is too large. Overly permissive rules might expose your IoT hub to malicious intenders.
A listening endpoint was found on the device.
An Allowed firewall policy was found (INPUT/OUTPUT). The policy should Deny all traffic by default and define rules to allow necessary communication to/from the device.
A rule in the firewall has been found that contains a permissive pattern for a wide range of IP addresses or Ports.
A rule in the firewall has been found that contains a permissive pattern for a wide range of IP addresses or Ports.
Edge module is configured to run in privileged mode, with extensive Linux capabilities or with host-level network access (send/receive data to host machine).

Same authentication credentials to the IoT Hub used by multiple devices. This could indicate an illegitimate device impersonating a legitimate device. It also exposes the risk of device impersonation by an attacker.
Insecure TLS configurations detected. Immediate upgrade recommended.

status.description: Recommendation status. When the recommendation status is disabled recommendations are not generated.

RecommendationConfigurationList.description: List of the configuration status for each recommendation type.

date.description: Aggregation of IoT Security solution device alert metrics by date.

topAlertedDevices.description: List of the 3 devices with the most alerts.

mostPrevalentDeviceAlerts.description: List of the 3 most prevalent device alerts.

mostPrevalentDeviceRecommendations.description: List of the 3 most prevalent device recommendations.

alertDisplayName.description: Display name of the alert type.

vendorName.description: Name of the organization that raised the alert.

description.description: Description of the suspected vulnerability and meaning.

count.description: Number of alerts occurrences within the aggregated time window.

effectedResourceType.description: Azure resource ID of the resource that received the alerts.

entities.description: A list of entities related to the alert

extendedProperties.description: A bag of fields which extends the alert information

AutomationProperties.description: A set of properties that defines the behavior of the automation configuration. To learn more about the supported security events data models schemas - please visit https://aka.ms/ASCAutomationSchemas.

isEnabled.description: Indicates whether the security automation is enabled.

scopes.description: A collection of scopes on which the security automations logic is applied. Supported scopes are the subscription itself or a resource group under that subscription. The automation will only apply on defined scopes.

sources.description: A collection of the source event types which evaluate the security automation set of rules.

actions.description: A collection of the actions which are triggered if all the configured rules evaluations, within at least one rule set, are true.

AutomationSource.description: The source event types which evaluate the security automation set of rules. For example - security alerts and security assessments. To learn more about the supported security events data models schemas - please visit https://aka.ms/ASCAutomationSchemas.

ruleSets.description: A set of rules which evaluate upon event interception. A logical disjunction is applied between defined rule sets (logical 'or').

scopePath.description: The resources scope path. Can be the subscription on which the automation is defined on or a resource group under that subscription (fully qualified Azure resource IDs).

AutomationAction.description: The action that should be triggered.

actionType.description: The type of the action that will be triggered by the Automation

AutomationActionLogicApp.description: The logic app action that should be triggered. To learn more about Security Center's Workflow Automation capabilities, visit https://aka.ms/ASCWorkflowAutomationLearnMore

logicAppResourceId.description: The triggered Logic App Azure Resource ID. This can also reside on other subscriptions, given that you have permissions to trigger the Logic App

uri.description: The Logic App trigger URI endpoint (it will not be included in any response).

AutomationActionEventHub.description: The target Event Hub to which event data will be exported. To learn more about Security Center continuous export capabilities, visit https://aka.ms/ASCExportLearnMore

eventHubResourceId.description: The target Event Hub Azure Resource ID.

sasPolicyName.description: The target Event Hub SAS policy name.

connectionString.description: The target Event Hub connection string (it will not be included in any response).

AutomationActionWorkspace.description: TheLogAnalyticsWorkspacetowhichevent data will be exported. Security alerts data will reside in the 'SecurityAlert' table and the assessments data will reside in the 'SecurityRecommendation' table (under the 'Security'/'SecurityCenterFree' solutions). Note that in order to view the data in the workspace, the Security Center Log Analytics free/standard solution needs to be enabled on that workspace. To learn more about Security Center continuous export capabilities, visit https://aka.ms/ASCExportLearnMore

workspaceResourceId.description: The fully qualified Log Analytics Workspace Azure Resource ID.

AutomationRuleSet.description: A rule set which evaluates all its rules upon an event interception. Only when all the included rules in the rule set will be evaluated as 'true', will the event trigger the defined actions.

AutomationTriggeringRule.description: A rule which is evaluated upon event interception. The rule is configured by comparing a specific value from the event model to an expected value. This comparison is done by using one of the supported operators set.

propertyJPath.description: The JPath of the entity model property that should be checked.

propertyType.description: The data type of the compared operands (string, integer, floating point number or a boolean [true/false]]

operator.description: A valid comparer operator to use. A case-insensitive comparison will be applied for String PropertyType.

AutomationValidationStatus.description: The security automation model state property bag.

isValid.description: Indicates whether the model is valid or not.

nextLink.description: URI to fetch the next page.

alertType.description: Type of the alert to automatically suppress. For all alert types, use '*'

lastModifiedUtc.description: The last time this rule was modified

expirationDateUtc.description: Expiration date of the rule, if value is not provided or provided as null this field will default to the maximum allowed expiration date.

reason.description: The reason for dismissing the alert

ScopeElement.description: A more specific scope used to identify the alerts to suppress.

field.description: The alert entity type to suppress by.

allOf.description: All the conditions inside need to be true in order to suppress the alert
